RT @phielkema: Last night we published the results of EIOPA's latest #insurance #stresstest and I'd like to highlight a few aspects:
¬†
- th‚Ä¶

The #liquidity component of the #stresstest showed that the liquidity position of participants appears to be a less significant concern than solvency positions given the sector‚Äôs large holdings of liquid assets. 8/8
Nevertheless, the #stresstest also revealed that a section of the market still heavily relies on transitional measures, which, unlike long-term guarantees, are to be phased out by 2032. 7/8
Long-term guarantees measures, which are part of the #SolvencyII regulation, helped absorb part of the severe but plausible #shocks, limiting the drop in participants‚Äô #solvency ratio. 6/8
The insurance industry demonstrated that it has tools at its disposal to cope with adverse market and economic effects (reactive management actions). 5/8

The #capital component of the exercise confirmed that the main #vulnerabilities for the sector stem from #market shocks, and, specifically, from the decoupling of the risk free rate and risk premia, the so-called double-hit scenario. 4/8
This robust #buffer allowed participants to absorb the shock of the adverse scenario. 3/8
Despite the grave economic and financial implications of the #COVID19 pandemic, the European #insurance industry entered the #stresstest exercise with a strong level of capitalisation. 2/8

EIOPA has just published the #results of its 2021 #insurance #stresstest exercise in which 75% of the EEA industry participated. üè¢

#EIOPA #AI #insurance

As the amount data increases, more complex models can be built and this can impact #transparency. On the other hand, this innovation also has benefits for consumers and insurers. Good governance can support this balancing act.
#EIOPA #AI #insurance

Why is transparency and explainability of the use of #AI important in #insurance?
The use of non-traditional data in AI systems needs to take into account data protection and privacy concerns. Transparency for consumers is essential for trust and the accuracy of their data.
